sentences.en: A man of moral integrity does not fear any slanderous attack.
He makes slanderous statement about the prime minister on television.
sentences.cn: 他在电视上讲话诽谤首相.

sentences.en: Her slanderous words soiled his reputation.
sentences.cn: 她的毁谤损害了他的名誉.

sentences.en: How could he choke back his indignation at the slanderous charges his opponent levelled against him?
sentences.cn: 对于他的反对者加在他头上的种种诽谤,他怎能不义愤填膺 呢 ?

sentences.en: In the court, he thought the charges were slanderous rumours.
sentences.cn: 在法庭上, 他认为对他的指控是造谣中伤.

sentences.en: Men were more evenly divided , with roughly half wanting to punch the slanderous classmate.
sentences.cn: 男性中却有一半人想揍这个诽谤他们的同学.

words.tran_cn: 诽谤地；造谣中伤地；恶毒地
诽谤的；诽谤性的；中伤的

trans.tran_cn: 诽谤的，诋毁的，造谣中伤的
trans.tran_en: a slanderous statement about someone is not true, and is intended to damage other people’s good opinion of them
